revised_title: Vestibulo-Ocular Reflex and Cerebellectomy in Decerebrate Cats
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on decerebrate cats to measure the frequency transfer function of the vestibulo-ocular reflex in response to sinusoidal head movements. They found that the frequency response was flat over a range of frequencies from 0.02 to 1 Hz. Cerebellectomy or reversible cooling of the cerebellum caused a significant reduction in low-frequency gain, suggesting that the cerebellum may play a role in integrating vestibular signals.
